verse: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.
Large crowds gathered around him, so he got into a boat and sat down, while the people stood on the shore.
Then Jesus used stories to teach them many things. He said: “A farmer went out to plant his seed.

header: Why Jesus Used Stories to Teach

verse: The followers came to Jesus and asked, “Why do you use stories to teach the people?”
Jesus answered, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of heaven, but others cannot know these secrets.

header: A Story About Wheat and Weeds

verse: Then Jesus told them another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.

header: Stories of Mustard Seed and Yeast

verse: Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man planted in his field.
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”
Jesus used stories to tell all these things to the people; he always used stories to teach them.
This is as the prophet said:
Then Jesus left the crowd and went into the house. His followers came to him and said, “Explain to us the meaning of the story about the weeds in the field.”
Jesus answered, “The man who planted the good seed in the field is the Son of Man.

header: Stories of a Treasure and a Pearl
A Story of a Fishing Net

verse: Jesus asked his followers, “Do you understand all these things?”
Then Jesus said to them, “So every teacher of the law who has been taught about the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house. He brings out both new things and old things he has saved.”
When Jesus finished teaching with these stories, he left there.
He went to his hometown and taught the people in the synagogue, and they were amazed. They said, “Where did this man get this wisdom and this power to do miracles?
He is just the son of a carpenter. His mother is Mary, and his brothers are James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas.
And all his sisters are here with us. Where then does this man get all these things?”
So the people were upset with Jesus.
So he did not do many miracles there because they had no faith.
